DataElement.preferredName: Malignant Lymphoma First Cancer Progression Biopsy Histology Other Type Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term to describe the structural pattern of the malignant lymphoma cells at the time of biopsy for first progression of malignant lymphoma different from those already specified or mentioned.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Malignant Lymphoma First Cancer Progression Biopsy Histology Other Result
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: (ma-LIG-nant) Cancerous; a growth with a tendency to invade and destroy nearby tissue and spread to other parts of the body._A malignant (clonal) proliferation of B- lymphocytes or T- lymphocytes which involves the lymph nodes, bone marrow and/or extranodal sites. This category includes Non-Hodgkin lymphomas and Hodgkin lymphomas._Preceding all others in time or space or degree._A pathologic process in which alterations at the molecular level result in a more aggressive cytologic and phenotypic profile and clinical course of a malignant neoplasm._The removal of tissue specimens or fluid from the living body for microscopic examination, performed to establish a diagnosis._The study of the structure of the cells and their arrangement to constitute tissues and, finally, the association among these to form organs.  In pathology, the microscopic process of identifying normal and abnormal morphologic characteristics in tissues, by employing various cytochemical and immunocytochemical stains._Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned._The result of an action.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: (ma-LIG-nant) Cancerous; a growth with a tendency to invade and destroy nearby tissue and spread to other parts of the body.:A malignant (clonal) proliferation of B- lymphocytes or T- lymphocytes which involves the lymph nodes, bone marrow and/or extranodal sites. This category includes Non-Hodgkin lymphomas and Hodgkin lymphomas.

Concepts.definition: Refers to abnormal cell activity manifested by decreased control over growth and function, causing tumor growth or spread into surrounding tissue and adverse effects to the host.

A malignant (clonal) proliferation of B- lymphocytes or T- lymphocytes which involves the lymph nodes, bone marrow and/or extranodal sites. This category includes Non-Hodgkin lymphomas and Hodgkin lymphomas.

Property.preferredName: First Cancer Progression Biopsy Histology Other Outcome
Property.preferredDefinition: Preceding all others in time or space or degree.:A pathologic process in which alterations at the molecular level result in a more aggressive cytologic and phenotypic profile and clinical course of a malignant neoplasm.:Removal and pathologic examination of specimens in the form of small pieces of tissue from the living body.:The study of the structure of the cells and their arrangement to constitute tissues and, finally, the association among these to form organs.  In pathology, the microscopic process of identifying normal and abnormal morphologic characteristics in tissues, by employing various cytochemical and immunocytochemical stains.:Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.:The result of an action.

Concepts.definition: Preceding all others in time or space or degree.
A pathologic process in which alterations at the molecular level result in a more aggressive cytologic and phenotypic profile and clinical course of a malignant neoplasm.
The removal of tissue specimens or fluid from the living body for microscopic examination, performed to establish a diagnosis.

The study of the structure of the cells and their arrangement to constitute tissues and, finally, the association among these to form organs.  In pathology, the microscopic process of identifying normal and abnormal morphologic characteristics in tissues, by employing various cytochemical and immunocytochemical stains.
Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Released per approval by B. McClure-Shimel. mc 10/4/11

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The free text field that describes another response when other is chosen from a list of values.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Not otherwise specified.:Specify; be specific about something; define clearly.:Text; the words of something written.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
Be specific about something; define clearly.
